history.content:
I took Data 100 with DeNero and CS161 with Weaver and CS161 definitely had the higher workload. The 2nd project (the design one) for 161 was the biggest time sink, the rest weren't too long. None of the Data 100 projects took very long to complete, though I was somewhat comfortable with pandas before entering the class.

-------------
Despite to what some students say, d100 is actually time consuming if you are not very familiar with the required libraries already. If you have taken data8 or have worked with pandas, seaborn, scikit-learn, or other visualization/ML tools then it will be smooth for you. In my case, I did not take data8 and it was a little rough at the beginning and the student above is right, projects and homework can take a lot of time to complete. Be ready to cover lots of material relatively fast. The only good thing about it is that TAs/Piazza are a good supported resources. I hear cs161 is hard but not as much as other upperdivs. Some people say cs161 is at pair with cs168, but I cannot say for sure. Hope this helps.



---

data100 is difficult if you didn't take the prerequisite classes, but that's not a useful comparison. better compare would be cs161 without cs61c to data100 without data8. and cs161 is harder than cs168 because cs161 has significant more project.

anyway, data100 is easier than cs161 and most other upper-division classes.

I took Data 100 with DeNero and CS161 with Weaver and CS161 definitely had the higher workload. The 2nd project (the design one) for 161 was the biggest time sink, the rest weren't too long. None of the Data 100 projects took very long to complete, though I was somewhat comfortable with pandas before entering the class.

-------------

Despite to what some students say, d100 is actually time consuming if you are not very familiar with the required libraries already. If you have taken data8 or have worked with pandas, seaborn, scikit-learn, or other visualization/ML tools then it will be smooth for you. In my case, I did not take data8 and it was a little rough at the beginning and the student above is right, projects and homework can take a lot of time to complete. Be ready to cover lots of material relatively fast. The only good thing about it is that TAs/Piazza are a good supported resources. I hear cs161 is hard but not as much as other upperdivs. Some people say cs161 is at pair with cs168, but I cannot say for sure. Hope this helps.

I took Data 100 with DeNero and CS161 with Weaver and CS161 definitely had the higher workload. The 2nd project (the design one) for 161 was the biggest time sink, the rest weren't too long. None of the Data 100 projects took very long to complete, though I was somewhat comfortable with pandas before entering the class.
Is data100 lighter than cs161 in terms of workload?
history.subject: Data 100 vs CS161 workload?
